dialogues.text: Two couches, one facing the window. The Connection turns on the lights and double locks front door. She walks over to the window. Passes the couch. Freezes. Teeth lies stretched cut on the sofa. He raises his .38, Eases himself up to a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONNECTION
dialogues.text: I don't know where he is. Tf haven't seen hin. The .38 moves away from her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘There. The Driver floors the accelerator. THE FIREBIRD , eke With the Flying Tiger on the hood. Teeth climbs into the passenger seat. Looks over to his wheelman.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID 243
dialogues.text: The one who approached the Driver in the Bar. He was looking for work. Found some with Teeth. Now he's going to find out about competition. TEETH . uy Looks back, sees the Driver.

dialogues.speaker: TEETH
dialogues.text: GO, ZO, go. The Kid spins the wheel. Swerves in.front of the Pickup. Pishtails toward the exit. Both cars go broadside into the street.

dialogues.speaker: THE KID CHASE
dialogues.text: They race away from the station. The Firebird pulls ahead, Opens a big lead with the faster machine... First corner. The Kid takes his car into it wide. Drifts through the bend, snakes away. The Driver brakes late, goes through it tight, gains twenty yards. . Cont.  a 493

245 cont. Long straight. Pirebird now forty yerds ahead of the Pickup. Traffic lights a block down. The Firebird makes them on the green. Turns left, then takes a quick right. The Driver goes through the lights as they change to red. Follows the Firebird to the right. . - Now thirty yards behind, The Kid takes the big car down a city street. Several fast turns, The Driver shaves the gap between them with each corner.. Traffic streaming by. Cross street coming up. Qne way. The Firebird slows then pulls into ‘the cross traffic. Without halting at the stop sign. Wrong way on the one way, Thirty yards back the Driver hurtles the Pickup after hin Both cars full throttle. They roar through the oncoming one-way traffic. Weave in- and out. The Driver closes to ten Yards, Distance between them remaining constant. The Kid swings the Firebird down.a side street. A long straight. The Pickup now falling further behind. Again thirty yards between the cars. The Firebird makes a hard left. Blasts through it. The Driver appreaches the turn. ‘(oes straight past it. Teeth watching through the rear window. Sees him pass by.e. The Pickup going flat out. Then the Driver brakes. Skids the Pickyp off the road. He sweeps between the parking lot and an old building. Crashes .through a wooden fence on the fer side. Comes out into an atley, Roars up to the street at the end. Stops between the buildings that front onto the road... A long moment before the Pirebird glides into view. The Driver floors the accelerator... In the Firebird the Kid sees the Pickup at the same noment. Tries to swerve. The Pickup coming. forward like a miasile. Cresses the firet lane, The Kid sees the Driver coming at hin. on an angle. Can't believe it. Slams his foot flat on the pedal. Cont,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “U 493 98 245 cont.1 Rubber burning onto the blacktop... The big Firebird fishtailing down the road. The Pickup following behind under control. The tail of the Firebird swings in front of the Driver. The Kid fighting the wheel. / Straightens the car up. The Pickup stays close behind. Both cars slide sideways and turn down another street. Pactories on either side. Teeth reaches across in front of the Kid. Jries a shot at the Pickup.. Slug creasing across the hood. The Player screams. Ducks. Bullet hele in the windshield. - Suddenly a factory wall appears at the end of the street, Dead end. The Kid brakes. Sends the Firebird into a wild spin. Goes off the road. Takes out a set of railings, arrives in a power depot... The Pickup hangs a U. Follows the Firebird around the back. High concrete walls rising upward. The -Kid brings the smoking Firehird round the far end of the “pullding. Trucks parked in the back. No exit. The Pickup. coming on behind, fo one side a wire swing gate blocks a service ramp. The Kid smashes the Firebird into it. Sends the hinges flying. The Pickup roars after him down the ramp... The Kid loses back end... Smashes through wooden double doors inte a huge warehouse The Firebird straightens, doesn't back off... Noses for the opposite end of the building. The Pickup follows at speed. The back doors of the warehouse loom open... The Kid hurtles the Firebird through and inte the next Warehouse see Blazing down the aisles... No doors at the end -- a sliding 180, and back down the aisle straight at the Driver... The Pickup accelerates. Another 100 by the Kid. Then a hard right... Crates flying, pillars emash at the fenders. The Pirebird comes up facing the open doors. Full throttle for daylight. But the Fickup appears from out of the shadows. Cont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me 493 99 2h5 cont.2 Full throttle for the Firebird. Teeth leans out the window. Fires three shots. The Kid panics. Spins the wheel. Sends the Firebird careening end over end after hitting a pillar, : Comes to rest after sme hing into the wall aear the entra A finished car. THE DRIVER : eke Slides sideways down the aisle. Comes to a halt. : Pulls the .357 from under seat. Looks at the Player.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Things go bad, you drive on out. He steps from the Pickup. Walks back toward the entrance. THE KID ou7 Dazed behind the Firebird's steering wheel. Slowly coming around. Teeth stays low, swings the door open. TEETH : akg Climbs out of the car. ‘Crouches behind the door. His .39 levelled through the window. Pointed toward the aisle. Then the Driver appears. . Running fast across an upper tier. Teeth sends a shot past . Tries another. THE DRIVER akg Falls, rolls, comes up shooting. His .357 roars three times. Slugs ripping into the Firebird's door. Then quiet.

dialogues.text: Passengers collecting their priefcases. Moving toward the doors,

dialogues.speaker: _ THE DETECTIVE . 7 . 263
dialogues.text: Forces his way desperately through the crowd. Gets blocked by the group of businessmen. He leoks down. Sees another black bag. Grabs it up from beside a Commuter. Pulls it open. The money stacked inside. The Commuter turns to face hin.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTER
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This yours, . The Commuter looks down at a black bag.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTER
dialogues.text: It's not mine. . He looks down at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTER
dialogues.text: Hey, mine's gone. ~

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Light brown briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: COMMUTER
dialogues.text: That's right. The Detective races back down the pullman. Swinging the black bag in front of hin. He stops at the men's rest room. fries the door, Still locked. Pulls out his .36, blasts the. lock away. In response three slugs rip through the door. Tear it off its hinges.  Cy 493

dialogues.speaker: THE DETECTIVE . 264
dialogues.text: Plat against the wall. Then dives for the floor in front of the open door. Sees the Exchange Man half out the window of the moving t Both men fire simultaneously. The Detective’s bullets send the Exchange Man all the way through the window. Through the window and dead. The Detective rises. “ Holsters his pistol. Stares at the open window, Then walks back down the aisle. Still carrying the black bag. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: UNION STATION
dialogues.text: Black Van perked at curbside. The Gold Plainclothesman leans against a fender,

dialogues.speaker: THE DETECTIVE 266
dialogues.text: Emerges from the station. Holding the black bag. Walks over to the van. Drops the bag on the hood, Looks at the Gold Plainclothesman.

dialogues.speaker: GOLD PLAINCLOTHESMAN
dialogues.text: Time [ got back inside, she was gone. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: RED PLAINCLOTHESMAN
dialogues.text: Did you nail him, Wait. :

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Yeah, And { got what was important. The Detective starts unlatching the beg.

dialogues.speaker: . DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Count it. RED PLAINCLOTHESMAN x It looks about right, DETECTIVE © Count it. All of it. conte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: x 266 Cont. The Red Plainclothesman shrugs. Climbs back into the van. , cUr TO:

dialogues.speaker: SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: Detective and the Gold Plainclothesman waiting. The Red Plaincliothesman climbs back out of the van,

dialogues.speaker: RED PLAINCLOTHESMAN
dialogues.text: Money's all here. Close to two hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Dirty money for clean...

dialogues.speaker: RED PLAINCLOTHESMAN
dialogues.text: What's the exchange rate,

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: About four to one. Should be fifty thousand back there in the iocker.

dialogues.speaker: GOLD PLAINCLOTHESMAN
dialogues.text: Let's start locking for hin. We find him with that key, eny jury will convict. Smile from the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: We can wait. He's going to come and pick 1t up. The two Plainclothesman start toward the station, ‘ CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Boor opens; the Driver and Player enter. His clothes st1li muddy and wet.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: We'll just be here a couple of hours. He pulls the curtains shut. Eicke off his shoes. Brops his jacket on a table. Walt. Cont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 268 Cont.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I've got rye or beer.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Whiskey. He walks into the bathroom. Comes back in and hands her a glass. Then sits on the bed. Trousers still wet. Sipping rye.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You don't have to stay. Everything goes okay, I'll get your money to you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: I might as well see it through. x He looks over to her, :

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You're crazy...Put the key in x a safe deposit box for six months. Then go get the monay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on a streak, I want to Play it out. I'm going to get tt tonight. The Priver gets off the bad. Starte toward the bathroom. Peeling off his mud-etained shirt.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: I know all about streaks. Every player says this time's different. The Driver steps at the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe you and I are alike. Cont.  oo 493

dialogues.speaker: REVISED
dialogues.text: She walks over to bin.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: No. When I lose, I just go - broke. You go to jail. The Driver smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: If it wasn't for that cop I'd tell you to go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: . DRIVER
dialogues.text: He's the reason I've got the rush on. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You Just want to make that cop choke to death. You don’t care about the money. ,

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I might even mail it to hin. ‘ PLAYER Sucker's game.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe. A long mament.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You think maybe you could wait for a while. He drops his shirt to the floor. Movea closer to her, Runs his hands through her hair. Then kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN STATION
dialogues.text: A few cabs in front. Occasional pedestrian waiting for a ride. very quiet. 107 268 cont.1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ne 493 REVISED - “THE DRIVER" - 6/13/77

dialogues.speaker: A BUS
dialogues.text: Cruises up the side of the station. Pesses the front entrance. Goes down the far side, stops.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Steps out of the bus. Followed by the Player. and a few other passengers.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You -okay.

dialogues.speaker: -DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yeeh. Weit. They Look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I'lt just be a couple of minutes. He walks toward the station.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE STATION
dialogues.text: 108 270 271 272 A few passengers heading for the boarding concourse. Newsstand and sandwich counter closed up. No one else around.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Walking quickly toward the main concourse. Glances to either side. All the hallways empty. He approaches the bank of jockers.

dialogues.speaker: LOCKER 132
dialogues.text: As the key goes in. The door swings wide. Suitcase resting there.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: Pulls the case out and rests it on the ground. Slams the locker shut. He cracks the lid open, Takes & long look. Then closes and snaps the latches. Turns back toward the entrance. Stopa. 273 274 275 bo  “VA 493

dialogues.speaker: THE DETECTIVE 276
dialogues.text: Waiting by the entrance. Plainclothesmen on either side.

dialogues.speaker: TSE DRIVER 277
dialogues.text: Hesitates. Looks evenly around the station. A phalanx of uniformed cops. Stretching across ell the exits. He looks back to the Detective, . Then walks slowly toward him. , Suitcase heid et his side.

dialogues.speaker: THE PLAYER 278
dialogues.text: Waiting on the sidewalk outside. Senses something wrong. Walks over to the entrance. : Looks through the plate-glass doors. Sees the uniformed Cops. And the Driver walking teward the Detective.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER , 279
dialogues.text: Now in front of the Detective. Gives him the black bag. The Detective opens the satchel, Empty. Totally empty. Not @ penny in it.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: What happened,

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Maybe we both got swindled. Wait. :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't even try. to dress -it up, , DRIVER . A lot of crooks ground these days. The two men look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Some ways I feel. as bad about it as you do. Welt. Cont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4 493 REVISED - "THE DRIVER" - 6, ilo 279 Cont.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Doesn't look Like I've got much of a case. How about that. The Driver starts awey. ‘ DETECTIVE ‘x, Driver. He turns back.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: You want to keep this. Holds out the black beg.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: I don't want to touch it. Walks away. A moment.’ Then the Detective faces the Red Plainclothesman. Tries to hand him the empty satchel.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE
dialogues.text: Get rid of this. The Red Plainclothesman doesn't raise his hand to the bag gust stands there. Long moment. Then the Detective moves away. Drops the bag inte a waste receptacle. Turns back, watches the Driver move through the exit.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE STATION 280
dialogues.text: The Player on the sidewalk. A black cab stopped beside her. Engine running. The Driver approaches. Looks at the black cab, Then looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: Nothing in the bag. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: It figured. Cont.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 493 REVISED - “THE "6 i ‘ 280 cont.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yeah, Sucker's game. A long moment.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You were wrong. I am like you. When I lose I just end up broke.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: You both lost a lot more then . I ever do. . xX Then, for the first tima, the Driver asks « question.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: You're taking off. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYER
dialogues.text: I've spent my whole life : trying not to break even. She gives him one of those smiles, He gives her one back, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself. She gets into the cab. He watches as the taxi pulls off. Keeps looking as it disappears inte the night. A moment. Then the Driver feels a presence behind him. Turns and sees the Detective, They stare at each other. For a long time. Finally give each other small smiles. Then thé Driver turns and walks away.
